data.question: What is the main challenge in using short a-peptide sequences for designing metal-organic frameworks (MOFs)?
data.answer: The main challenge is obtaining stable secondary structures from the short a-peptide sequences.

data.question: Which peptides were designed to coordinate with metal ions in the study?
data.answer: The designed peptides are P1 and P2 with terminal pyridyl moieties.

data.question: What was the result of silver ion coordination with peptide P1?
data.answer: Upon silver ion coordination, the 12-helix terminated by the 3-pyridyl derivatives adopted a 2:2 macrocyclic structure.

data.question: How did peptide P2 react to silver ion coordination compared to P1?
data.answer: Peptide P2 retained its original 12-helix conformation upon silver ion coordination, unlike P1 which underwent a structural distortion.

data.question: True or False: Both P1 and P2 adopted right-handed 12-helix structures in single crystals.
data.answer: True

data.question: What role did the head-to-tail intermolecular H-bonds play in the crystal packing of P1 and P2?
data.answer: They were involved in stabilizing the ordered metal-helix frameworks.

data.question: True or False: The sequence of the peptides did not influence the structure of the metal coordinated frameworks.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the utility of the metal-helix frameworks in the study?
data.answer: They were used in the adsorption of CO2.

data.question: True or False: The metal-helix framework of P2 showed no adsorption of CO2.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the impact of the position of the nitrogen in the pyridyl moieties on the metal coordinated foldamer assemblies?
data.answer: A subtle change in the metal coordinating site showed a drastic change in the supramolecular assembly.

data.question: True or False: The silver ion coordinated P2 12-helix is stabilized by two independent intramolecular 12-membered H-bonds.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the pore size of the self-assembled structure of P2?
data.answer: The pore size was found to be 5.9 c.

data.question: True or False: The length of 12-helices can be varied to design various types of porous functional metal-helix frameworks.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the result of the thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) on the P2Ag framework?
data.answer: No observed mass change of P2Ag framework up to 200 88C, indicating its stability against temperature.

data.question: True or False: The silver ion coordination and H-bonds driven porous supramolecular assembly of P2 12-helix was not crystalline.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the conformation of the N-terminus Aib residue in silver ion coordinated P1?
data.answer: It adopted a left-handed helical conformation upon silver ion coordination.

data.question: True or False: The structural analysis revealed that the N-terminus Aib residue adopted a right-handed helical conformation upon silver ion coordination.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the purpose of incorporating Aib residue at the N-terminus in both hybrid peptides?
data.answer: To obtain stable helical structures.

data.question: How did the researchers confirm the gas adsorption property of the metal-helix framework?
data.answer: By subjecting the powder of metal-helix framework obtained after grinding the single crystals to CO2 capture at 195 K.

data.question: True or False: The PXRD studies confirmed that there was a change in the metal-helix framework in the powder after CO2 capture.
data.answer: False
